content:
Get Started with Messaging in Service Cloud

Ready to set up a Messaging channel in Salesforce? Turn on Messaging in Setup and give agents and supervisors access. Configure your routing preferences and add Messaging to the Service Console.

Turn On Messaging in Service Cloud
Turn on Messaging so that agents can communicate with customers in standard and enhanced channels.
Give Users Access to Messaging in Service Cloud
Assign permissions to users who will message with customers or supervise agents.
Set Up Routing for Messaging Channels in Service Cloud
Use Omni-Channel to route customer inquiries sent over Facebook Messenger, WhatsApp, Apple Messages, or SMS to a queue, bot, or qualified support agent.

Add Messaging to the Service Console
Configure the Service Console to put all messaging tools at your agentsâ€™ fingertips. Add Omni-Channel and make the Send Message global action available.

This article applies to: Standard and enhanced WhatsApp, standard and enhanced Facebook Messenger, standard and enhanced SMS, enhanced Apple Messages for Business, and Bring Your Own Channel
title: Setting Up Messaging in Service Cloud
